stanza.line: Whilst I alone did call upon thy aidaid
My verse alone had all thy gentle gracegrace
But now my gracious numbers are decayeddecayed
And my sick muse doth give an other placeplace
I grant (sweet love) thy lovely argumentargument
Deserves the travail of a worthier penpen
Yet what of thee thy poet doth inventinvent
He robs thee of and pays it thee againagain
He lends thee virtue and he stole that wordword
From thy behaviour beauty doth he givegive
And found it in thy cheek he can affordafford
No praise to thee but what in thee doth livelive
Then thank him not for that which he doth saysay
Since what he owes thee thou thy self dost paypay
